# Calculate yields and production

## Yield proportion

The IRM script already calculates the optimality of the individual criteria as well as the climatic, landscape, soil fertility and soil physical properties groups of criteria.

The first method of calculating yield will calculate the product of the optimality of all criteria except those listed in the table above.


```{r calc_yield_1_i2, cache = TRUE, cache.whatever=params$Agg, fig.width=12,  out.width="100%", include = TRUE, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, eval=ba_crit}

# get the criteria that contribute to yield
rbyielddf1 <- dplyr::select(priorities, "rulebase_number","criterion","yield") %>% dplyr::filter(!is.na(yield))

rbyielddf1 %>% kable(digits = 3) %>% kable_styling("striped", full_width = T)  %>%  scroll_box(height = "500px")
# make an expression using the rule base numbers

yield_expr <- paste("cond_data_i2$yieldpc <- (")

for (i in seq(from = 1,
              to = nrow(rbyielddf1),
              by = 1)) {
  yield_expr <- paste0(yield_expr, "cond_data_i2$" , as.character(rbyielddf1[i, 1]), "_o * ")
  
}
yield_expr <- paste(yield_expr, " 100)")
yield_expr

# evaluate the expresion
eval(str2expression(yield_expr))
str(cond_data_i2$yieldpc)

# cond_data_i2 <- dplyr::select(cond_data_i2,-yield)

cond_data_i2_sf <- cond_data_i2 %>% na.omit %>% vect(geom = c("x", "y"))

dBy <- rasterize(cond_data_i2_sf, ra_mask, field="yieldpc")
names(dBy) <- c('yieldpc')

# export
output_geotiff(dBy, paste0("yieldpc_", params$INN2))

  dy <- dBy %>%
    as.data.frame(xy = TRUE) %>%
    na.omit

  
  gy <- ggplot(data = dy) +
    geom_raster(mapping = aes(x = x, y = y, fill = yieldpc)) +
    scale_fill_stepsn(
      n.breaks = 10,
      limits = c(0, 100),
      colours = hcl.colors(palette = "Greens", 10, rev = TRUE),
      guide = "legend"
    ) +
    scale_x_continuous(
      name = "",
      labels = function(x) {
        1.0e-3 * x
      }
    ) +
    scale_y_continuous(
      name = "",
      labels = function(x) {
        1.0e-3 * x
      }
    ) +
    coord_equal()
  
gy2 <- add_subdiv_plot(gy, paste(params$SUBDIV2))
gy2
```

# Compare the innovations

## Yield comparison

<div class="fold o"> 
```{r classified compare_score_maps1, cache = TRUE, cache.whatever=params$Agg, fig.width=12,  out.width="100%", message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, timeit = TRUE}
# create classified suitability map

d0 <-
  cond_data %>% dplyr::select(yieldpc, x , y) %>% na.omit #%>% vect(geom = c("x", "y"))

d1 <- cond_data_i2 %>% dplyr::select(yieldpc) %>% na.omit %>%
  dplyr::rename(yieldpc_i2 = yieldpc)

d2 <- cbind(d0, d1)

# complementary score
d2$compl <- (d2$yieldpc + d2$yieldpc_i2)

# difference score and class

d2$class <-
  ifelse(
    d2$yieldpc > d2$yieldpc_i2,
    paste(params$INN1),
    ifelse(d2$yieldpc < d2$yieldpc_i2, paste(params$INN2) , "equal")
  )
f <- function(row) {
  if (row$class == paste(params$INN1)) {
    return(row$yieldpc - row$yieldpc_i2)
  } else{
    if (row$class == paste(params$INN2)) {
      return(row$yieldpc_i2 - row$yieldpc)
    } else{
      if (row$class == "equal") {
        return(0)
      } else{
        return(0)
      }
    }
  }
}

d2 <- d2 %>%
  rowwise() %>%
  do(row = as_tibble(.)) %>%
  mutate(diff = f(row)) %>%
  unnest(cols = c(row)) #%>% vect(geom = c("x", "y"))

d2$class <-
  factor(d2$class,
         levels = c(paste(params$INN1), paste(params$INN2), "equal"),
         ordered = TRUE)


# this is needed to use the dynamic names in the values vector in ggplot

x <-
  paste0(
    "c(",
    paste(params$INN1) ,
    "     = rgb(0,   0, 255, maxColorValue = 255),        ",
    paste(params$INN2),
    " = rgb(0, 255,   0, maxColorValue = 255),        equal     = rgb(255, 255, 255, maxColorValue = 255))"
  )


gc <- ggplot(data = d2) +
  geom_raster(mapping = aes(
    x = x,
    y = y,
    fill = class,
    alpha = diff
  )) +
  labs(alpha = "Difference") +
  scale_fill_manual(name = "most suitable\ninnovation",
                    values =  eval(parse(text = x))) +
  
  scale_x_continuous(
    name = "",
    labels = function(x) {
      1.0e-3 * x
    }
  ) +
  scale_y_continuous(
    name = "",
    labels = function(x) {
      1.0e-3 * x
    }
  ) +
  coord_equal()



gc2 <- add_subdiv_plot(gc, paste(params$SUBDIV2))
gc2

```
